The Mac & Cheese was yummy & pretty much everything else on the menu is good! (since you're on the strip you're going to be paying more then average price but overall good place)

I had really high hopes for this place - I mean who doesn't love chicken n waffles? I ordered the regular chicken and waffles and felt like it was a bit dry and the chicken was a bit cold... 

The waffle fries and shake was excellent

I didn't know Bruxie started in Orange, CA. It's a chain, so if you're from Southern California, you have an opportunity to eat something else in Vegas. But if you're not from Southern California, Bruxie isn't bad!

My hard-to-please mother really enjoyed it. And if my mother thought Bruxie is delicious, 5 stars for everyone.

Let me put it out there, it's not cheap. It's not In-n-out or Chick-fi-la. It's like $13 for a burger without a drink or fries, but that's kinda normal in Vegas.
We got the Original, which is a chicken sandwich. The combination of light airy waffle, crispy thick chicken patty, cole slaw and maple syrup was very satisfying. Just writing this review, makes my mouth water.

You can't eat this burger/sandwich without getting your hands in syrup. So please wash your hands before and after.

The restaurant is located in New York New York, towards the strip. It's right next Shake Shack which is more visible if you're driving on the strip.
Food is good but could not wait to get out of this place. The music is obscenely loud.  And what kind of person designs a place to have lighting fixtures dangling right in front of televisions.
Good food, different plays on the waffle theme. I love this place. The portions were perfect, not to big, but big on flavor.

Chicken skillet or chicken sandwich. Both are delicious and super affordable. The customer service here is super! The girls are very knowledgable and nice. Get the real syrup, it's worth the extra dollar. The free syrup is the fake like aunt Jamima high fructose corn syrup shyt. So yeah pay the extra dollar and get real syrup.

What a treat I stumbled upon as I was walking toward the t-Mobile arena, between the New York New York & Monte Carlo casino I found this comfort food gem.
Chicken sandwiches with a waffle replacing bread.

I got the Nashville sandwich, and the bacon Mac & cheese. The sandwich was fantastic, the Mac was ok. Next time I'm in Vegas I'm coming back here for sure.

We came here for brunch and ordered two breakfast sandwiches (one with bacon, one with sausage). Both were good. The waffles are not like waffles I've had in the past - these are thin and crispy, making them good "buns" for the sandwiches. The portion was too big for me, I could only eat half of my sandwich. 
Good location on the strip in the park.

One of my favorite places to get chicken and waffles because you can get it all dressed up or plain. The waffle is perfectly crispy and not soggy. The chicken is seasoned well and moist on the inside. The original chicken and waffles is always a safe choice. Between the buffalo blue cheese and the Nashville, I prefer the buffalo blue cheese since the Nashville was too spicy for me. For sweets, I really enjoyed the s'mores waffle. I would pass on the liege waffle. Overall, great customer service!

*****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge*****
68/100

The food here is amazing! The Holy Chicken breakfast sandwich was the perfect combination of sweet and spicy. The variety of flavors make for one incredible experience! It's a messy one, but man is it good! 
The bacon egg and cheese was good too! Ask for the vanilla late iced--it's life changing on a hot day!

A crisp, golden brown, airy, light waffle with just the right chew.  Be it dripping with warm maple syrup, topped with fruits, preserves, jams, and whipped cream, or as a bun for a perfectly seasoned boneless chicken breast, spicy BBQ Chicken, California club, pulled pork roasted turkey, pastrami and Swiss, roasted mushrooms and goat cheese.... wait, what were we talking about?

Bruxie, the Cali born waffle joint has made it to Vegas.  And yes, it is as good as expected.

Outstanding, with no sweetness.  Nothing get's in the way of making a great waffle.  The Naked with cinnamon sugar or maple syrup the perfect way to whet the palate.

In general, the consistency of the waffles hold up well to the "wet" fillings with their outer layer maintaining the crispness.  

For breakfast, the prosciutto and Swiss, oozing with melted Swiss cheese and a fried egg, all kinds of good eats. A generous smear of whole grain mustard cuts the richness of the yolk perfectly.  Sub sage spiced breakfast sausage and cheddar and you get a solid country sausage and egg breakfast sandwich, equally tasty.

Of course, chicken and waffles.  Take an aggressively seasoned, not too heavily coated,  deep fried, crisp on the outside, juicy on the inside boneless chicken breast, give it some sweet heat (chili honey) and top it with some cider slaw.  Calories and fat aside, oh yeah!  For something that will make your head tilt like a confused dog, try the roasted mushroom and goat cheese.  Sun dried tomatoes, goat cheese, arugula, lemon vinaigrette and a balsamic reduction in a waffle?  It works and well.

Friendly service.  Prices are what they are.  Expect to pay $10 for any "sandwich".

A great fast food option for the frenetic Strip.

A Great find in Vegas.  After a Short walk from our hotel, we found "The Park" between New York, NY and Monte Carlo near the T-Mobile arena, this is not to be confused with the Beer Park in front of Paris Hotel.  When we arrived there was a short line, we ordered at the counter and our food was delivered.  I ordered the Hot Nashville Chicken Waffel sandwich and I added an egg to it.  I was very pleased with the quality and taste of the food.
Cute fast food restaurant. There was a line but it moved really quickly. We tried the original Fried Chicken waffle sandwich AMAZING so tasty ! The Tito's lemonade perfect for a hot day

Delicious!!! The buffalo fried chicken was perfect. The pastrami sandwich was so flavorful. The flavor of the waffle was light & yummy. The place was clean, the workers we're friendly. Definitely going back! Hoping they open one off the strip for locals to get to easier (:
Chicken and waffles like only the southeast knows how to do, but nestled right on the strip!

Bruxie had my vote when I noticed the creme brûlée waffle! Sooo good! 

The staff was super friendly

The waffle of your dreams is here.  I prefer the regular breakfast waffle which is crunchy on the outside and light and airy on the inside.  This is the waffle to compare to all others.  
Great addition to the strip.  I'm a fan of the original location in OC but its very busy and difficult to get to.  I was very excited when I walked by and saw this location opened!! 
Good price for the amount of food.
We did not have the sandwich waffle which is denser but will be back.

First time having chicken and waffles and it was delicious. I thought the meal was going to be messy and hard to eat but the waffle and chicken are very easy to bite through. Hardly any mess. (Spilled my drink on my girlfriend). Split the holy chicken and that was just the right amount of food. Service is pretty fast.

This was my first visit to Bruxie....and it was not the last. I'm not going to lie, we ate there 2x in one day! The Fried Chicken and Waffle sandwich is what dreams are made of! It is SO tasty. 
The Chili Honey on the Original Chicken and Waffle Sandwich is the BEST! 

Can't wait to get back to Vegas to eat there again!!!
Was excited by the reviews. But I didn't like it. Thought it was too greasy. And the waffles were greasy too. Staff was nice.

Ordered the chicken pesto with a side of waffle fries. The entree was LOADED with sundried tomatoes and the fries adds cold and stale.    As with everything here the music is loud and overwhelming.   
Employees were friendly

Service was good, Fried Chicken and Waffle sandwich was great with honey chili sauce ( messy but delicious) and Grilled Mushroom and Chicken Salad had a nice blend of flavors with goat cheese and sundried tomatoes.  Tasty lunch!
Nashville, smore waffle, ballast point. Outdoor seating, great views, very affordable and delicious

Fried chicken and waffles are what comfort food is all about. The chicken was crispy and crunchy and the waffle was soft but firm enough that it did not fall apart. The syrup had great flavor. One of the best sandwiches I have had.

The mac and cheese was great. It had a bit of tang which was enjoyable. The thick pieces of bacon were a nice touch.

You order at the counter and they bring the food to you when it is ready. For Vegas, this is a cheap meal and a great value

Love thisd place and the price is reasonable as well. We ordered the Holly Chicken Waffle and I must say the Siracha Mayo sauce is tasty. Chicken is fried perfect.we will come back tomorrow for a diff. Items!
Great fried chicken sandwiches but little greasy. I had the Nashville fried chicken which was spicy but balanced with the slaw. Def come here for a great and affordable breakfast in Vegas.

If you're in Cali or Las Vegas you need to find this place. Now. I read a lot of positive reviews but I'm picky about chicken and waffles so I wasn't a believer until I tried it for myself. I ordered the holy chicken waffle sandwich and instantly fell in love. The chicken was crispy, the waffle was fluffy, the fried egg was runny, and the sriracha sauce added the perfect kick. Dip it all in syrup and you have your hands full of messy, blissful deliciousness. Or you can opt for the fork method but that's just not as fun! This breakfast easily makes my top 10 best breakfasts ever list. I'm happy to be heading home from the west coast, but so, so sad to be thousands of miles away from Bruxie.
Only had the naked waffle $5.95.  I had the cinnamon  sugar on top which made it light and sweet.   They have some nice beers on tap $8.00 but I needed coffee.

Thank you Yelp! Crispy, juicy, flavorful! I got the Holy Chicken minus the sunny-side up egg. So delicious! There was a line but it moved quick and the food was quickly delivered as well. Definitely recommend! The only reason I didn't give a full 5 stars was because the fries were overly salted. We want to come back for the dessert waffles!

Came here for dessert and a root beer float. We got the Lemon Cream and Berries= $6.50 and the root beer float was $3.95. Pretty good for just dessert, next time I plan on trying some chicken and waffles.

Meal #6 of Vegas 2017 Trip

I kept wanting to call it Brexit. And really I wanted to take a Brexit from Bruxie because the place was super cold. They kept the door propped open during the lunch hour and we all wanted to wear our coats. Plus the music was way too loud.

It didn't improve that much with the food. The husband and I got the classic fried chicken waffle sando. If I was blindfolded I would have just guessed I was eating sauce on crispy bread. Any subtlety of flavor was lost with the sweet chile sauce which overwhelmed everything. I had hoped the slaw could have cut the spicy sweetness (and for the record I can handle spiciness) but there wasn't enough of it. I did request pickles which helped a little.

The waffle fries were good at least.


Our Las Vegas 2017 Trip

5 Stars
Border Grill, Mandalay Bay (brunch)
Grimaldi's, The Palazzo
Bouchon Bakery, The Venetian (snack)
Eggslut, Cosmopolitan (snack)

4 Stars
Payard, Caesars Palace
Border Grill, Caesars Palace
Shake Shack, New York New York

3 Stars 
Tournament of Kings, Excalibur
BRUXIE, NEW YORK NEW YORK
Therapy, Downtown

Bomb.com! 
I specifically chose this place because they have thin waffles just like Roscoes in LA! Hubby ordered the Nashville hot with fries and I (liking to keep it simple) got the waffle with chicken tenders. Really great meals for both of us, but honestly everything coming out of the kitchen looked delicious!

welcome to Bruxie. This is a casual dining chicken and waffle joint just a short walk to T-mobile arena and just off the strip by NYNY and Monte Carlo. It is a good pre or after concert dinner spot that is fast and food is good. We stopped in on the way to a concert and wanted something fast and filling. We ordered the southern style tenders. There was a good portion and they were crisp and juicy. he sauce was good and added to the taste of the chicken. Only 3 stars due to how slow we got our food. 

Thank you for dining at Bruxie. We may go again, Food was reasonable it's fast casual so no real service to speak of. Give it a try if you are in area or goin to a concert or need to have something after. It's quick and casual

One of the best chicken and waffle places in Las Vegas - located right beside New York NY hotel. It can get a little busy at peak times but the wait isnt too long. The chicken is super tender and has a great spice blend and flavor profile. The waffles are perfect texture and everything is great drenched in maple syrup. Great stuff.
4.5/5
Such a fun place! Took me a minute to find--entrance is outside on the street not through the casino to way it was trying to lead me. I cannot wait to come back and try ALL the food in the menu!
This place is fantastic! A little pricy for a sandwich but worth it. Every bite is delicious. I highly recommend this place if you are hungry and in need of a quick bite.

Bruxie no joke is giving Roscoe's a run for their money. If you into chicken and Waffle combos this place is the spot! I tried the original chicken and waffle combo with the irish nachos and caught a food coma...It was that good..Waffles were crispy and light just like I like em, and the chicken was flavored well..Real cream soda to top off the meal had me super satisfied..I would recommend this place to anyone looking to try a alternative to Roscoes

Amongst the best meals that I had in Vegas. We wanted chicken and waffles, this was the place to go. The chicken batter had a tinge of spice that was offset by the syrup. The crust was thick and crunchy, but no complaints here. I prefer a Belgium waffle. Theirs was a little harder and thinner than I like, but still tasty. Mine in particular was undercooked in some places. So was my chicken, which is why this is a 4 out of 5. On another positive note, the mango/strawberry (I don't remember) lemonade was fantastic. And they had it sitting out so you can get your own refill. Highly recommended.

This place was decently priced and waffles were good. I'm a huge waffle person, but I was not blown away by the actual flavor of the waffle itself. They get one star because there was a hair on my daughter's waffle. Bottom line is, the management did not apologize and said it was part of the waffle mix.
I love their spicy chicken and waffle sandwhich! This is why I stay at nyny or Monte Carlo. Being close to bruxie is my reason. I NEVER regret going there. So glad to see it in Vegas.

I went here for brunch and tried the Nashville hot chicken waffle sandwich. Perfect amount of spiciness the chicken was A+ but I thought the waffle could be better. My BF ordered a chicken plate with waffle and we shared waffle nachos which was way too much food! Haha. Large portions and definitely worth trying when in Vegas. Get the Nashville hot chicken and maybe try the spiked milkshake that I was unfortunately too full to try. Also they no longer have the poutine waffle fries. The location is great for people watching and right by the TMobile Arena.

So I decided to try Bruxie and let me tell you, it was the best decision I ever made. The food was delicious, friendly service. Although the line was long to order food , it was worth the wait. I definitely will be back next time I visit Las Vegas
Holy waffle... this with a side of eggs and they had to role me out of this place... best waffle place I've been to so far!!!

Absolutely RIDICULOUS how AMAZING  this food is.. I can't even begin to explain how much New York needs a
 Bruxie... if Your reading this just go eat here. Fast service clean fresh (free refills) delicious succulent food. A++

Best Place for Chicken and Waffles hands down!!!
Must try!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Nashville Sandwich was bomb!!! 
Original Skillet is a must try!!

This place is so fucking good!! Better than Roscoes!!

A little tricky to find but its right around the Shake Shack.

Parking free for one hour at NY/NY.

One guy stands out in service. Always Checking to see if everything is okay. Very friendly. Attentive. Was there on this Sunday morning. Appreciate his hard work!

Highly recommend the 2 piece because the waffle it comes with is scrumptious and better than the plain waffles the sandwiches come on. And 2 was way more than I could eat so if you are just one person I wouldn't go for 3. The butter is super sweet and mapley so don't go thinking you're going to need any additional syrup. You will not! I only wish the iced coffee options had been a bit more robust and it would be cool if they offered some hotter chicken but it was delicious as is with the chili honey drizzle! My husband got the holy whatever it's called sandwich and it was wonderful also. The Sriracha sauce was not just plain Sriracha, it was this delicious creamy substance. It was tasty altogether but looked quite challenging to eat! We arrived at 10ish on a Sunday and the line was only about 10 minutes. Friendly, fun service too! 

When we walked up I was thinking this place looks like it's just going to be hipster overrated but it turned out to be as good as the reviews suggest.
Delicious! That's all I have to say! Good hangover cure. Maybe a little more expensive than your average brunch spot, but it's Vegas... Check it out!

Saw the pictures and ratings and decided to try it.  It definitely did NOT disappoint!!!  Yep, that's a Bruxie Sriracha BBQ chicken, egg bacon and waffle sandwich!!   Ooooooohhhhh. Eeeeeeeemmm.  Geeeeeee!!!!!!!

Holy fried chicken and waffles! I'm in love and I wish we had a Bruxie in NY *sadface*. It's such a simple idea. Fried chicken and waffle sammiches, but it's done so perfectly. I went with 4 girlfriends on a trip to Vegas and wanted to grab a quick bite before a pool party. This was exactly what we were looking for. You order at the counter, get a number and a waiter brings you your food. Quick and efficient. Light and fluffy waffles with a slight crisp to the outer layer acted as the bread for perfectly fried, juicy chicken breasts that weren't too oily. We each tried a different sandwich and ALL of them were amazing. The fries were decent and the drinks refreshing. My gf's and I joked that we should look into opening one in NY. My inner fatgirl would be an issue though.

Loved it! The wait was about 15-20 minutes but it well worth it. The food was hot and fresh and very tasty. I had the holy chicken sandwich. Soo good and got me full! Totally recommend while staying in Las Vegas!
Wonderful chicken and waffle spot near TMobile Arena.   Waffles were fluffy yet crisp to provide a good sandwich base.   Chicken was outstanding too.

I had the breakfast sandwich and it was absolutely delicious! I personally would have preferred the waffle a little bit more soft but regardless it was delicious! 

I tried the buffalo mac and cheese and it was good! Next time I have to try the cheddar bacon waffle  I'm glad they have some locations here in So Cal. 

I'm giving it a 4 star rating only because the line is always long and I hate to make line for a soda refill and let my food get cold.

This restaurant is great for a quick bite or sit-down, whichever is your preference. For me, I was in a hurry (and I really wanted to try the chicken and waffles here), so ordering to-go was the best option. 

The fried chicken is sandwiched between a waffle with cole slaw on the side. They have a house syrup sauce that tastes incredible. I recommend adding the syrup and cole slaw into the "sandwich" to experience max flavors. The chicken was super crispy -- they way they should be! Overall, decent prices, quick, and delicious.

We were out around The Park (and discovering that my idea of "park" needed to be re-calibrated), when we happened upon Bruxie. The whole night was great, but this really made it. Honestly, I don't think I had that high of expectations going in, but they blew them out of the water. Have tried a few items and looking forward to trying more - everything has been a hit.
The food is made from scratch so if you are in a rush well then I advised come later. I am the king of 1 stars but this place delivers. Damn good. Chicken is on point. They offer white and dark meat

I have wanted to try this resturant for a while now, as it has been on my foodie list for sometime now.  I can honestly say that this place will be removed from my list!!   To begin, I was thoroughly disappointed in the cleanlines of the ketchup, water, syrup station and friendliness of their staff members upon arrival.  After receiving my meal, I went to the front for the ketchup and they were out at both stations.   When,  I asked if ketchup stations could be refilled I was told to hold on, however I waited for over 10 minutes for that to take place.  However once I received my Ketchup from the waiter she threw it on the table at me in an fit.  Our drinks never arrived with our meal so we had to get them ourselves. 

Next, for the price of the food  we could have stayed home.  This place truly does not exemplify the standard of chicken and waffles.  Therefore,  my review of this establishment is a no bueno!!

Was so pleased and grateful to the staff at Bruxie this week. I accompanied my boyfriend who was attending CES. I'm able to work remotely but the idea of staying in my hotel room all day just because I knew there was reliable wifi was a bit of a drag. I ventured out to Bruxie for lunch and brought my laptop along in case I found a good internet-enabled spot. Bruxie to the rescue! The restaurant is adjacent to a small park that provides free wifi ("TheParkWiFi"). I camped out at my table for 4 hours and the staff was nothing but lovely to me. As a server in a previous life I know that campers can be obnoxious, so I tried to keep any requests to a minimum. But a server at Bruxie went above and beyond by consistently checking in with me, bringing me endless refills, and even letting me sample some ice cream (delicious, definitely coming back for the ice cream).

Beyond that, my lunch was moan-as-you-chew good. I got The Original fried chicken and waffle sandwich and was so impressed with the juiciness of the chicken, fresh and crispiness of the waffle, and overall flavor profile. For a fast casual restaurant, Bruxie is now on my list of favorites.

The waffles were on the perfect side of Belgium: Light and fluffy with right amount of crisp! 

The chicken was so juicy with their signature sauce as a compliment: not overwhelming!

My first time and I just learned there is one in Santa Monica.  There was a line but the wait was not to bad. I got to try the Buffalo chicken tenders and were very tender inside and slight crispy on the outside. I also took a bite of my boyfriend's original chicken waffle which was awesome!! Add some hot sauce and you'll be good! And we both shared the creme Brule waffle which was perfect not too sweet but enough to satisfy your sweet tooth. I will definitely be visiting the Santa Monica location

Loved this place. Waffle was nice and crispy and stayed that way after a few hours. The chicken was perfectly fried and seasoned. I had the BBQ honey sandwich with the onion straws. Awesome! Can't wait to return and try a different t sandwich.
Absolutely amazing.  Some of the best chicken and waffles (in sandwich form) I've ever had.  Counter service.  The Irish Nachos were also a hit.
So good we came back 3 times on our trip.  Each dish is delicious and the coffee is on point.

What was going to be a 1-star review quickly became a 5 star review... we ordered an original (chicken and waffle sandwich). We watched others get their food and my husband was growing more and more grouchy at the fact we didn't have ours and those that ordered after us got theirs. He got up, inquired about his food, and came back. The next thing you know they arrived with a refund as an apology and not one, but two chicken sandwiches. The sandwiches were really good. The service became amazing. And I left with a happy husband.

I'm a local I pass this place dozens of times but the line is always long, I finally got a break and went in and ordered there original chicken and waffle sandwich with spicy honey drizzle, the waffle was thin and done well the fried chicken cutlet was delicious crispy and moist inside, cooked perfectly. I'm a retired corp exec chef 45 years all over the country, believe me I know, these folks got it figured out the staff was very pleasant and they kept it very clean. I'll be back!

Don't even know where to begin - SOOO good and satisfying! Literally can't get enough of this place. There's plenty of spacious seating.
Kickin' chicken - crispy, spicy chicken, just amazing 
Holy chicken - perfect if you want to go all out and have bacon and an egg with your chicken+waffle
Good crazy expensive and not good. Service was no so good, dinning area freezing cold

Fried chicken was way too salty with a very thick crumbly coating.  The bacon cheddar waffle and coleslaw we're great though. Hope they address the salt issue. Also the chocolate topped custard is wonderful.

Can't say enough good things about this place. Came back time and time again despite all the offerings of Vegas. The delicious chicken and waffles sandwiches, the amazing staff, and the awesome location (right next to the Monte Carlo/Park MGM) kept me coming back for more. The big portions also keep you full longer so you don't overspend at the other restaurants on the strip!

This place is one of the best treats on the strip. I love it for two reasons. It is one of the most reasonably priced places on the strip.  While it's still expensiveTheir food is also delicious. I've had both the sandwiches and the strips and while I prefer the strips they are both good. The fries are also on point. I would eat them more often than Chick-fil-A if I could, which says a lot.  I wish there were more locations throughout Vegas.

This was my first meal when I landed in Las Vegas and I'm glad it was. I got the Holy Chicken waffle sandwich and 'holy, was it delicious!'. The waffles were fluffy and paired very well with the crispy chicken and smoked bacon. The Sriracha sauce on this sandwich added a nice kick to the flavor. Waffle fries were standard waffle fries, in my opinion but I absolutely loved the waffle sandwich. We got here at 9am when it opened for breakfast and there was already a line out the door. Definitely recommend to come earlier to avoid standing in a longer line. I was very surprised by how crowded it got at 10am. However, it could be worth the wait!

I didn't think i would enjoy this as much as i did, i ordered the green eggs and ham which is a waffle loaded with ham, two eggs and pesto, i also added avocado. I thought it would be sweet or just too heavy for breakfast but it was not heavy or sweet just delicious! I loved the crunch you get from the waffle.
Had to wait a bit but it was totally worth it. We had the mushroom salad and regular chicken and waffle sandwich. Super yummy

I had the only vegetarian option I spotted on the menu, which was the roasted mushroom & goat cheese waffle sandwich.  Very good!  Great food and ready in a hurry.  I had a salad that was drenched in too much dressing, so I couldn't finish it.  Not my favorite place ever, but if I'm in the Park again and am looking for food, I'll consider this a viable option.
Very good food! Didn't realize this place was there until we walked by it one day before leaving. Pleasantly surprised how good the waffles were. Had the green eggs waffle, amazing.

Passed this place on the strip, talked about going all weekend, finally made it by Sunday afternoon & it did not disappoint! As a vegetarian I had the green eggs & ham without the ham & it was fabulous!! 10/10 recommend.

BEST CHICKEN AND WAFFLES I HAVE EVER HAD. Defiantly try the cheddar waffle with the 2 piece chicken. I came back to this place already to try the original waffle and it did not disappoint. Will be returning soon! Great for bfast/ lunch and dinner

Love! Wish they had a location in SF. Everything on the menu is fantastic. However, although the fried pickles are really good I do wish they weren't cut as thick. Highly recommend for a tasty and quick meal that doesn't leave you feeling gross like McDonald's.

I usually don't go for chicken and waffles but this place changed me. I came here on a Tuesday around dinner time and there was a long line that reached the door. After ordering, the food came out pretty quickly. My friend and I shared the original fried chicken & waffle sandwich as well as the kickin fried chicken tenders. The chicken is drenched in this sweet and spicy syrup which was just absolutely delicious. The waffle was very light, crunchy, and buttery. The tenders had a good amount of spice to it and was super crispy which I liked. The waffle fries and pickles were a good addition as well. I'm back in Seattle now and I still think about that chicken sandwich.
Delicious food with unexpected combinations! Try the strawberry lemonade and holy cow!

Absolutely amazing. The fried chicken with its honey sauce was perfectly cooked and so crisp. The fried pickles were mouthwatering. Honestly the best chicken I've ever had, and their in house made soda was tasty as well

Finally tried Bruxie, I got the Nashville chicken waffle and wife got holy chicken waffle, she loves hers, as for mine, it's good but the concept of waffle holding my chicken is so unusual and weird, first I cut my waffle and chicken to smaller pieces because it was so big, after doing that for the first half, I finally said screw it, hold it and chow it down, the chicken is not extremely hot, just got a little kick to it, I'm not too crazy about the pickles, gave them to my wife, might go again and try something else tonight.
Oh the orange drink is extremely good, not sure if it's a soda or what, my daughter got that, she usually doesn't like soda but she loves hers.
Lines can be super long on the weekend, but as soon as you order, food will come fairly quick, so it really depends on how fast people order their food.

Take away the location, the view and the novelty of The Park, and all you are left with is an overpriced meal. I'll be honest, I had great hopes and expectations for this place, but my experience really took a turn to negative town, and then sped down that road, from the very beginning. Wanna hear more? Read on...

We got to the restaurant and the greeting was not much different than that I get at McDonalds. It was literally a "NEXT" cattle call to get to register. And that is when the fun started. I ordered a chicken finger meal with a strawberry lemonade and my girlfriend ordered a cobb salad with a Chardonnay. Sadly, what they call a Chardonnay on the menu, was actually a Pino Grigio (written right on the bottle), and the poorly-trained cashier kept insisting they were the same thing. I don't blame him for the mixup, I blame management. 

Anyways, we were given a pager and told to sit anywhere we wanted to and the meal would come to us. We waited for what seemed like 10 minutes to receive my lemonade and then another 7 minutes for my food. Now, I do not mind waiting for good food to be served, but I did mind waiting that long to get an overlay sweetened strawberry lemonade and food that is very comparable to Jack-in-the-Box or Popeye's chicken. The fried chicken on both plates was half seasoned, borderline burned, and on the dry,  so it was nothing to write home about. In particular, the Cobb salad wasn't good nor visually appealing... tomato chucks were too big, the bacon had a stale taste and texture to it and the lettuce was straight out of a bag (I saw them refilling their salad station when we were leaving).

Like i said earlier, I really wanted the experience to be good. So, to make sure I left no proverbial stone unturned, I also ordered their Mac and Cheese which truly looked scrumptious. Unfortunately, that was yet another let down. They serve their Mac and Cheese in a cast iron skillet...but that is only for show. I thought they baked the dish in the oven (in the cast iron skillet) to melt the cheese, but they do not. In fact, the 'cheese' was gritty (a sure sign it was made with powered cheese), a bit on the cold side and under seasoned... not good.

Lastly, the appearance of the staff for it being such a new restaurant, left much to be desired. Uniforms are disheveled, and the staff is comprised of a bunch of teenagers who seem to be running the place. Want some delicious fried chicken? Keep walking because you will not find it here.

I came here with the expectation of "the best fried chicken I've ever had" and left the restaurant completely disappointed and utterly speechless. IT WAS THE WORST CHICKEN AND WAFFLES I'VE EVER HAD. Maybe the main chef was sick on the day I went? I have no idea as my chicken was neither tasty nor crispy! Hello Bruxie... the chicken from a chicken and waffle is suppose to be crispy, not soggy af and tasteless. But oh.. the waffle was super hard and dry and crunchy though...a cost of $10 a waffle is not enough for you guys to buy milk and put a sufficient amount of it into your waffle batter? Seriously... if you want better chicken and waffles.... walk down to hash house a go go, this place is NOT worth your $$, your time, nor your stomach space.

When I found out the opening of The Park included a Bruxie, I was ecstatic! I used to love eating waffle sandwiches in Downtown Brea, and now I can enjoy it here in Vegas. Sweet!

We came on a hot summer evening right before they closed. The staff was super awesome for letting us order 5 minutes before 11pm. What wasn't awesome, however, was the air conditioning being off. Fans can only do so much when it comes to the Las Vegas heat. :(

I ordered my usual Original Chicken Waffle Sandwich made with their seasoned fried chicken, chili honey, and cider slaw. My waffle was broken, making it rather messy to eat. That's my only complaint though since they were so crispy & fluffy like normal.

Hubby ordered a Grilled Californian Pesto Chicken, which he enjoyed a lot. All sandwiches are made with their all natural, hormone-free chicken marinated in buttermilk, mmm! We also shared a (necessary) order of waffles fries. And by share, I mean fight over. :3

Oh! I do have another complaint. We took our little guy and ordered him the crispy chicken tenders kid's meal. I was so disappointed when his plate came out with 2 small chicken strips and a few waffle fries. It was NOT enough food for a 3-year-old, let alone older kids! I'm not a proponent for prices, but $6 is a lot of money just for him to be hungry less than an hour later.

We all drank our meals with fresh strawberry lemonade. Warning: It is super tart and full of pulp! I liked it, but if you're craving something sweet, you should order one of their old-fashioned sodas made with real cane sugar instead.

As much as I love Bruxie's, I probably won't frequent this commercialized location on the Strip. I will say, however, that it is worth trying!

I go to school in the south, where I've had some of the best chicken and waffles. This place is alright - I got the Nashville-style hot chicken and waffles and found the fried chicken to be unbelievably greasy and the waffles to be bland. I'd give it 3 stars for taste, but bump it up for the awesome location, the fast serving time, and the nice ambience. This place gets crowded but people move in and out pretty quickly.

My husband told me I needed to try this place so on my next business trip, it was our first stop. We arrived for lunch and just ordered traditional chicken and waffles. The chicken was delicious however the waffles were cold for both of us. Not sure if this is by design but it cost two stars in my rating. I'm sure my husband will bring me back on our next visit but unless the waffles are served fresh and hot, I may not be eating with him

Bruxie violated two of my pet peeves and still gets 4 Stars, so you know I was pretty impressed by the food.

Pet Peeve #1- It's an order at the counter type place. These places always make me feel rushed and uncomfortable. Even though I was the first customer of the day, I felt like I was holding things up, so I just ordered an Original Chicken and Waffle Sandwich and a Belgian Mocha.

Pet Peeve #2- Why do restaurants that work so hard to get things Crispy and/or Crunchy put sauces and wet condiments directly on them? It always turns the crispiness and crunchiness to sogginess.

Now onto the food itself. The Original has Buttermilk Fried Chicken, Chili Honey and Cider Cole Slaw. The Chicken was perfectly seasoned and the parts that weren't turned soggy by the slaw had a wonderful crunch. The Waffles were the absolute lightest, crispiest, best I've ever had. Again, except for the parts that had contact with the slaw. Even the slaw itself was very good and the Chili Honey added a really nice sweet heat to the sandwich. My Mocha was the best coffee I had this Vegas trip.

Bruxie is wheelchair accessible and the food is fantastic, so I will definitely be back. I'll just order the Cole Slaw on the side!

Bruxie is incredible, point-blank. I write this review as a lover of all things waffles, but not necessarily fried chicken, and I still found this place to be amazing.

Came by before a Knights game, so it was pretty crowded, but the line moved very quickly. Grabbed a seat, and patiently waited for my heavenly waffle dinner to be served. I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich, but am also a sucker for an authentic liege belgian waffle, so I ordered one of those as well... and waffle fries, because how could you not?

Grilled chicken itself can be really hit or miss, but Bruxie nailed it. The waffles that make up the sandwiches are very interesting. They're not what you'd expect as a "normal" waffle- they are thin and airy, so they are super crispy instead of doughy. Super unique, but nothing wrong with it! The sandwich was delicious, and the Bruxie sauce on it was out of this world. The liege waffle was also everything I hoped it would be! If you've ever had one, you know how incredibly sugary, buttery, fluffy, and crispy they are. Bruxie's hits on all of those.

As a waffle lover, I cannot recommend this place enough. But even if you do not have a particularly odd obsession with waffles like I do, if you love good food, you'll enjoy Bruxie.
Fuuuuuuuucking delicious chicken tenders OMMG. Be sure to try the sodas and all the condiments too!

Great food at a cool venue.  Bruxie is located at The Park, the promenade connecting the Strip next to New York New York Hotel Casino with the T-Mobile Arena, home of the NHL Las Vegas Golden Knights. the Park is spacious, comfortable, great vibe, local artists painting everywhere, interesting sculptures and piped music.  Bruxie is a fun, modern place with a very friendly staff.  Lots of indoor seating with limited outdoor seating.  The line can be very intimidating but then you realize its not a line to be seated but an ordering line.  It takes a while, but once you order, the food comes pretty quick.  We had the Holy Chicken! waffle sandwich, waffle fries, slaw and a chocolate custard shake.  Came to about $27.  I never thought much of the whole chicken and waffle thing, having it only once before and not being impressed.  This, however, blew.me.away.  Crispy maple glazed chicken, smoked applewood bacon, cheddar cheese, sriracha sauce and a sunny side up egg, wedged between a soft and airy on the inside and crispy on the outside waffle.  It was perfect.  I was making noises with every bite, the noises you make when its so damn good.  It's been six hours and I can't stop thinking about it.  The waffle fries were crisp and lightly seasoned.  The slaw was crisp and creamy.  The shake was rich and thick.  There was everything right and nothing wrong with this meal.
This is a really good place. Unique concept. Don't go there if you are looking for a traditional breakfast, but we loved the waffle-based food!  We will be back!

Yum! Yum! Yum!

I've been wanting to try Bruxies because I see it around all the time! Although I had to wait 30 minutes to order and 30 minutes for my food, it was still worth it! The sandwiches are unique and delicious! I recommend their max and cheese too! I wish they opened on the east coast!

Yum!!! Waffles are perfection and staff is awesome! You have to park in the lot of walk out from New York New York to access this place. The fried chicken and waffles are on point as well as the banana Nutella waffles. Strawberry lemonade is a bit on the sweet side, but just add water! Also, you get free refills here. Waffles fries are crispy and not greasy. Sandwiches are good too. Had the turkey BLT and there was a hint of maple syrup in it. Makes total sense since the bread outside the sandwich was a waffle! Will definitely come back here. Meal was delish!
Never heard of this little hole in the wall, but what a find.  Crispy chicken waffle sandwich was fantastic!!  Great seating area with a great view of the new square.  Vegas never disappoints !

Absolutely the best chicken n waffle sandwich I have ever eaten. My son and I having in Vegas for the past 5 days celebrating his 16th birthday. This by far has been our favorite spot,  and have already eaten here twice! From the waffle sandwich to the waffle fries they diffently  know what they're doing here.. By the way don't forget to try strawberry lemonade, delicious!

This is pretty interesting. I've had chicken and waffles before at roscoes but this is a bit different. For starters I like the way the chicken tastes much better. The waffles are much softer and compliments the chicken very well. It's not too pricey and it's for sure worth trying since its on the strip. It's next to New York New York right in front of the T-Mobile arena. Try it! Oh.. And the strawberry lemonade is pretty good as well.

Good little spot on the Strip in the Park. Used to visit the Chino location and was glad it made its way to Vegas! The Nashville Hot Chicken and the traditional burger are the best in my opinion but everything tastes better between waffles. 

Most people usually just shoot for the desserts but I only go for the meals. Great easy value for the Strip and good location

Oh Bruxie, how I wish you were located closer to me.  

Wait, second thought scratch that, I would become fat and my legs riddled with waffley looking cellulite... speaking of waffles... UGH I miss this place.  

We found Bruxie by accident in Vegas since we were trying to avoid the rush of people leaving their TVs as the superbowl was coming to an end.  They were totally quiet so we got a spicy chicken sandwich to share.  WHAT A MISTAKE!  I should NEVER have shared this sandwich.  IT was SOOOO good, but we had eaten so much junk earlier while watching the game I couldn't justify ordering another sandwich.  

So.... with that many places to eat, we went back a couple of days later to have lunch at Bruxie.  I orderd the crispy chicken waffle sandwich and hubby had the spicy chicken sandwich again.  I even ordered some Irish nachos which he had never heard of before.  Can I say?  NOM, NOM, NOM! 

SO yummy and tasty.  I would have gone there again had I had the chance but my wasteline is thanking me  for not doing so.  TRY IT OUT!!! Definitely well priced for such a tasty meal in Vegas.

Stopped by here on a night out. The prices are good and not outrageous like typical strip pricing. One of the best sandwiches I've ever had as well. Friendly staff that even came out and dropped the food off our order as we grabbed a seat away from the restaurant. I would recommend this place to anyone going out to the t mobile arena or around there.

One of the best food places we got to try in Vegas! It is located near New York New York! 
Ordering was quick and easy. Just go up to the counter and they'll bring your food by the numbers you were given. I ended up getting the holy chicken. It was delicious ... the chicken was huge lol. Pretty crispy, & juicy ...and it had an egg on it! I love eggs :). My bf had the original chicken. Haha he thought his was alright but he still enjoyed it. I'll def try the kickin chicken next time! I mean what else can go wrong when you have chicken and wafflesss! Oh and their fries are a small portion... so everyone should order their own fries :) 

Make sure you visit this place if you're in the area! I totally told all my friends about it since they're visiting Vegas soon!
Phenomenal breakfast. Quick counter service. Good prices compared to other Vegas restaurants. I had the green eggs and ham waffle sandwich with a Bloody Mary. Perfect hair of the dog brunch.

Phenomenal! Food was so frigging good! The fried chicken was perfect! Especially when you can get a juicy piece of breast meat. Sofas were great too. Naturally sweetened so there's a candy like taste to it!

Dang, I don't even like waffles, and yet this place has converted me to becoming a waffle lover!  Best dang chicken and waffles you'll ever find. I had the 2 piece with bacon cheddar waffles. Try the bacon cheddar instead of the plain--its really good. The chicken is delicious, and the waffle is cooked perfectly; a bit of crunch on the outside and soft on the inside with layers of deliciousness. I can't wait to try them again!

Food 3 stars, plus one for really good service. They are providing semi-table service so tip accordingly!

Free refills, plus you can change drinks if you want. I tried the strawberry lemonade. It wasn't too sweet or too tart. Not powerfully strawberry-ish, though.

Only 50cents to add cheese sauce to their side and drink combo. This place isn't price gouging at all and I respect that a lot in sin city.

Chicken waffle sandwich was intriguing. The chicken "breast" appeared to be a conglomerate of mixed chicken breast pieces, tenderized and breaded in a patty shape, rather than a single breast. It was nice quality meat mostly so I didn't mind. Just wasn't expecting it. Asked for my slaw on the side and it was probably less than 1 big forkful. Not upset I'm not that into slaw.

Waffle fries with cheese sauce on the side was good.

The waffle it's self was okay. Light airy and crispy. I was expecting a bit more tenderness, TBH.

The food I would rate 3 stars. Good not great. A nice easy lunch. The customer service pushed it up to 4 stars. The kid running around helping people and clearing tables was super zippy and cheerful.

When you go to a restaurant and you wake up the next day craving it, it deserves a good review. Had never heard of Bruxie before I found it searching Yelp while looking for brunch. While I have had chicken and waffles, the sandwich and skillet concept was new to me. And it works! Tried the original chicken and waffle sandwich, wasn't overly impressed with the chili honey sauce but it was decent. My favorite by far was the crispy chicken sandwich, with savory fried chicken breast with dill pickles sandwiched between waffles. Amazing. The waffles are crispy on the outside and soft inside. So good. The service both at the counter and table were great. This will be a staple for my next trip to Las Vegas.

Coming from someone who doesn't care for fried foods... I'd have to say this place was surprisingly good! Chicken wasn't overly fried, waffle fries were crispy, and the sriracha sauce.. bomb.com. Lastly, order a fried egg, you won't regret it.

Absolutely delicious breakfast waffle sandwiches and dessert waffle sandwiches. Incredibly delighted and fast service. The only thing I'd say is the coffee is atrocious so just don't order coffee but I enjoyed everything else so much I needed to give 5 stars

As I started to plot out where to eat for all of my meals while I was going to be in town, picking the last spot to go to before my flight home was by far the easiest.  I mean, how could I not hit up Bruxie?!  Considering how much I LOVED their Irvine location, this practically guaranteed a delicious ending to my trip.  Which kind of explains why I did it again last month!  Well, that and the fact that they're just that good!

Located on the outside of New York New York, and right next to Shake Shack (also love!), it's great how this part of The Strip finally has some better food options (we wouldn't even bother before).  Thankfully, everything about this Bruxie was just as amazing as the one in Irvine.  In fact, if anything, the menu actually looked slightly better.  The range of options was the same (fried chicken, waffle sandwiches, salads, etc.), but there seemed to be more variety now!

-- HOLY CHICKEN - Maple Glazed Fried Chicken, Applewood Smoked Bacon, Cheddar Cheese, Sriracha Sauce, Sunny-side Up Egg...$11.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bruxie-las-vegas?select=qwDv2kffPT3T-7ZqPHJIgA)
Aside from how the waffle fell apart after just a few bites (it needed to be crispier), I loved everything about this!  The egg, cheese, and bacon were perfect complements and I liked the glaze's sweetness.  The star was the chicken though - crispy, juicy, and super flavorful!

-- KICKIN' CHICKEN - Spicy & Smokey, Tangy Sauce, Shredded Romaine, Pickles...$11.95
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/bruxie-las-vegas?select=BvswIgx2g-M04lPohc41Zg)
Even though it wasn't as spicy (or kickin', if you will) as I thought'd be, I thought this was great!  The chicken was moist, nicely battered, and still very tasty.  What's more, the tangy sauce was awesome and the waffle was much better this time around!

For all of their waffle sandwiches, you can make it a combo by adding a side of waffle fries and a drink (with free refills) for $3.95 more.  Sure, the sandwiches are filling enough on their own, but this is well worth the money!  The waffle fries are insanely good (perfectly crispy, lightly salted) and I LOVE their Strawberry Lemonade (a little sweet, but nothing a little more water won't fix).

Despite having tried something different every time I've been to Bruxie (here and Irvine), I'm still disappointed in myself for not having tried their regular fried chicken yet!  Fried chicken & waffles dishes have failed me before (a la Roscoe's), but I can't imagine I'd have to worry about that here.  I guess I have even more reason to come back!  Alhough, considering how much I love these guys, I never really needed another one.
This is the second time I've eaten at Bruxie's. The chicken & waffles are absolutely amazing! The service was great, too. I'll definitely eat there again when I visit Las Vegas

While scrolling through food options on Yelp, I came across Bruxie. I read the words fried chicken and waffle and knew I had to try it out. It was so tasty and crunchy. The chicken and waffle was flavorful throughout my meal. The waffle was thin like almost the size of bread. Compared to other waffles I have tasted in the past, this waffle maintained its crunch. I'm not a fan of fluffy foods unless it is dessert so eating a crunchy waffle really makes me smile. 

If you are with people who do not like chicken, they do offer a plain waffle option as well.

Delicious, Inventive, Gobble-icious.....did I mention absolutely delicious? I first went to Bruxie's in Huntington Beach, CA and became totally addicted!!! The place is fun and friendly, two musts for an enjoyable experience, and I just looooove waffles, so of course Bruxie's is my go-to waffle joint.
 My fave picks are the Bacon, Egg and Cheddar and the Lemon Cream with Berries... I have been known to go totally bonkers and have BOTH on the same visit (and then not eat for the next 48 hours)!!
 Of course the Fried Chicken Waffle is a classic, and equally scrumptious, and so are the other waffle sandwiches, but I always seem to order the Bacon or the Lemon waffle and they are always, always the BEST part of my day. Waffles and cappuccino and a cold lemonade 
 The B.E.C has crispy, smoked bacon, a just-right runny egg, and the right amount of melted cheese to combine with the waffle in every bite and make you want to keep eating all day long.....
 On the other hand, the silky slightly tart lemon creme with berries is a dance party in your mouth, hitting all the right notes and putting a Chesire-cat-like smile on your face. Words to the wise: Go to Bruxie's .

I have been looking to try a chicken and waffles place that's out of the norm. I've found a couple, but I was looking for something specifically in Vegas as I was going to be on vacation there. I found bruxie in one of many extensive searches I do and was intrigued. They were not only chicken and waffles, they were sandwiches. Totally got me. And for good reason. I got the holy chicken, and when you bite into it, the name makes all the more sense. It's the perfect combination of sweet and savory in every single bite. I also got waffle fries and a strawberry lemonade and everything just seemed to pair so well. I was in waffle chicken heaven. As for service and crowd, I went at a fairly quiet time, around 2 or 3. It's more towards the beginning of the strip so you don't get that crazy crowd. GO TREAT YOURSELF!

This was my second time just going to this restaurant chain in general, so I was excited to see this place here in Vegas.

My boyfriend and I decided to be adventurous and try out their limited time only Korean style burger that was supposed to be a bit spicy. We ended up getting a side of fries and a cream soda as well that apparently they make in house.

It didn't take too long for our order to come out and when it did, it looked really good. They were nice enough to cut the sandwich in half, but the slaw in it kept falling out. It was really salty cause of the soy sauce and it drowned out the flavors a lot from the sandwich in whole. But the chicken was nice and crispy and the waffles were soft and fluffy with some crunch too on the outside. The fries were of course good cause it's hard to do them wrong the sods was pretty good too.

I should've stuck with my gut instinct to just get their signature chicken and waffle sandwich. But glad I gave it a shot though.

Great concept! I had the original sandwich with bacon, and the strips with the cheddar bacon waffle. Both were delicious! Good quality food for any time of the day. The Nutella waffle was also great ! I would definitely go again !

I wish more of the meals came with fries/weren't an additional charge, but the food was satisfying for brunch after a long night out! Living in LA, I've surprisingly never tried chicken and waffles. Was it super great quality? Not exceptionally, but what made me give it 4 stars is that the people working there were super friendly & attentive. It was really refreshing and unique to see such good service at an order-at-the-counter type restaurant. They deserve some recognition, I wish I got their names! Thank you though :)

Pretty cool place to check out, if you are in the mood for chicken and waffles. I ordered one of the original chicken and waffle sandwich with waffle fries. It was pretty delicious. They also sell 100% cane sugar soda:)

I've been a fan of Bruxie from Orange, CA and I'm glad to see that Las Vegas has their own in New York New York right next to Shake Shack. If you been to here before in Orange then the menu is similar.
 
For this visit, just wanted to try the chicken tender meal to see how it compares. The waffle cut fries were good and the chicken tenders were hot and juicy. I would definitely want to come back and try the chicken and waffle sandwich and the creme brulee dessert sandwich. 

What is diffrent though is that they do have a small menu for beers on tap and they do carry Stiegl which is a plus! Next, they do provide a clean space with their napkins, condiments, syrup, and water cups. Finally the seating area is spacious but it won't seem like there will be a seating problem since it is located in The Park so there is a lot of outdoor seating too.

Finally it seems like they are training their staff still and I do appreciate that they did check on our table a lot to make sure we were ok. They do charge a 3% surcharge to ensure healthcare and benefits for their team for each transaction but it's not a big deal since everyone of their staff was helpful and friendly that our table interacted with. Definitely will be back to try more!

Not really sure what they hype is with this place.  I guess it's the concept of chicken & waffles in a sandwich form.  The chicken was moist and had a nice crunch to it.  The waffles was light and thin.  I guess I'm not a big fan of it being in a sandwich form.  I would rather it be in the traditional form where I can slab the waffle with butter and just pour on the syrup myself.  The chicken didn't really have that much flavor to it.  I guess it got overshadowed by the syrup and coleslaw.  I am also not a big fan of their cane sodas.  It gives the soda a different taste than I am used to with the Coke products.

Stopped in for a quick desert.  Got a Liege Waffle with Chocolate (of course).  I've had Liege Waffle's before and this was not my favorite.  Still worth a visit for a quick and easy late night desert.

We had such a great time at Bruxie, with great ambiance and customer service, and the food was delicious. The waffles are so light, and amazing - not what you'd expect from a waffle. The hot pastrami was great and their famous chicken waffle was incredible...and the ice cream was perfect!

Comfort Food, waffles, fried chicken, great breakfast, ice cream, sweets and even a salad ;)

PROS: food quality, originality, fast efficient service, very tasty, they go out of their way to help. You get the feeling they r glad u came.


CONS: not many vegitarian choices, if on a diet, just have a protein drink, n apple n keep walking. Don't even stop

Opening day here at Bruxie. Menu looks the same as Orange, CA location. Food is about the same too. Being opening day, food was cold and salty for the burger, but guessing they are getting the bugs out. Green, eggs and ham were a hit. Breakfast is available all day. Cane sodas on the menu from their soda fountain.  Seating inside and ample outdoor seating in the "Park" area. Will come back once they are fully up and running.

If you're not into the whole fried chicken and waffle thing, let me recommend the mushroom and chicken salad. It. Is. DELICIOUS. Scattered on a bed of fresh cut romaine is juicy chunks of chicken breasts tossed with very aromatic sun dried tomato (gives the salad a nice sweet and tart flavor, very summery) and yummy cut crimini mushroom. The portion of the salad is generous and it will leave you full. It's one of my go-tos on the menu every time I'm at Bruxies. :)

They have a large area for seating so finding somewhere to sit wasn't hard and it seems less busy than Shake Shack, good for us.

It's one of the cheap eats you can get around Vegas on the Strip (as more is sprouting around) next to Shake Shack near NY, NY.

There is something about coming to Vegas and eating at restaurants that are located all over Los Angeles, but our first time dining there is in Vegas! ha! The same thing happened with EggSlut - last time I came to Vegas, I tried EggSlut for the first time even though there are a ton in LA!

Anywho, this time my family wanted a quick lunch and something we have not tried before, and I always wanted to try Bruxie and here we are! And here was one of the best meals of our trip or of any restaurant!

We had the $5 coupon for signing up online for their newsletter which was awesome, it's a great coupon, and although the prices are not too expensive, this makes it even cheaper!

We ordered two sandwiches - the Original and the Holy Chicken
WOW these.are.dee.lish.ous!!!

The original has chili-honey, coleslaw, and their original seasoning. The chicken is so light, juicy, tender, while the batter is also so light and crispy, thin, and just so tasty with all the seasonings. The waffle is absolutely amazing - fluffy, crispy, and airy and oh so good, and together they make quite a good size sandwich! It isn't too spicy but the sweet-spicy honey-chili is amazing.

Now the Holy Chicken . . . my god this was amazing and almost puts Roscoe's to shame with the chicken and waffle combo! 
Again, the delicious waffle, so fluffy and crispy and thin, but the chicken is glazed in maple syrup - seriously, what is better than maple syrup and fried chicken!? Thick, crispy applewood smoked bacon for some added savory-salty flavor. Thick slices of gooey cheddar cheese sticking to the waffle. A hint of sriracha for some kick, and the cherry-on-top, a fried egg cooked perfectly with the yolk running down the chicken and soaked up by the waffle!

 Seriously, thank you Bruxie for this phenomenal lunch with the absolute best fried chicken, waffle, and combination of ingredients as well as the great service for something special and perfect in Las Vegas! I will be happy to return next time I am in Vegas and visit the LA locations!

My boyfriend and I have always wanted to try this place out but we never found the time to go when we go to the LA area.

We were in Las Vegas and I was so excited to see this place near our hotel. We made a point to try it before we left. It went way beyond our expectations.

I had the Holy Chicken my boyfriend had the Crispy Chicken.

Two thumbs up!

Heyyyyy waffle sandwiches! Who doesn't love a sweet and savory combo that hits the spot on first bite? Fried chicken, drizzled in syrup, topped with bacon, and then a sunny side up egg? What?

For the um... waffle haters? Their chicken fingers and their mac n cheese were prettttttty good too!

Although I am not usually too wild about eating chicken and waffles, I can recognize that this is one of the better chicken and waffle places. The waffle is crispy and appears fried, allowing it to serve effectively as slices of a sandwich. I bought the crispy chicken sandwich, which was quite delicious and crispy. My friend tried the buffalo chicken, which was not as crispy and enjoyable. The sandwich is pretty heavy; you will not go hungry for a while after eating one. 

Lines can get long, so this might not be a good option if you are in a hurry to get somewhere.
Simply amazing! Perfect for that Las Vegas hangover. Every time I go to Vegas I always stop here for breakfast.

I gotta say, coming from the south, the Land of Chicken and Waffles, I had little expectation for Bruxie. I went there for brunch with my cousin who swears by it so I decided to give it a try. I had no interest in getting their waffle sandwiches and to truly gauge it, I went with fried chicken and waffles served the way I know it with an extra over easy egg on the side and some mac and cheese. Man oh man, I was blown away by their waffle!!! Theirs had caramelized edges that I've never had anywhere and it was divine. Their fried chicken cut wasn't what I would usually order but they only had one kind, the boneless, mostly white meat cut. Seasoning was pretty good and it was fried crispy but it was a little dry. If it were a piece of dark meat, it would have been juicier. The mac and cheese wasn't anything to rave about, of course I've had and make better ones but it did complete the whole Southern "cheat day" Brunch I was gunning for. 

That waffle was so good I wanna get myself a waffle iron just to try to recreate it! More reason to come back to Vegas for sure!
It's a bomb waffle and chicken sandwich. The angry mac && cheese is really good. The kickin' chicken and the mac have a little kick. Definitely will come back when in town.

First off, portions here are huuuge. The chicken sandwich alone would've been more than enough. I ordered the fries too, which was unnecessary and not very good. It was extremely salty. The sandwich was also salty but it wasn't as ridiculous as the fries. The chicken was very nice and big but I couldn't help but think that it would've tasted better between buns rather than waffles but I guess that's their thing. All in all a good place but if you're not a fan of salty food then you probably wouldn't like this place.
Chicken and waffles on the strip!  Does take a little bit to get your order and its a gut buster but its good!

Best chicken and waffles! Variety of different waffle sandwiches. This a must visit place when in Vegas. The atmosphere is casual and trendy. This place receives a lot of pedestrian traffic from the surrounding areas and the line is frequently out the door; For good reason.
Great place, out in LV for a few days and ran into this gem. Don't go here if your on a diet.

Came here to Bruxie's for a quick bite.   We have been to the original location in orange ca and wanted to check this out since it's next to our hotel (Monte Carlo).  Soon as we came in we were ignored by the lady at the cash register because she was too busy counting the tip jar money.   After about a minute, she finally acknowledged us.    I got the original fried chicken waffle sandwich.   After about 10 minutes our sandwiches came out.   The waffle was fluffy but a little soggy from the sauces.   The chicken was crispy and really juicy.   I would definitely come back.   The only thing I would change is the front workers to greet everyone that comes in, instead of ignoring them.

For someone who doesn't usually order waffles anywhere else, I love the variety of offerings at Bruxie.  Not everything on the menu has to do with breakfast, either.
This Sin City location is very nice and spacious with some huge windows overlooking the Park Vegas, great for people-watching.  The lines were not really long when I've gone and service is quick and friendly.  

What I've Had:
Fried Chicken Poutine:  just yum!  Treat yo'self to this item for the combo of waffle fries, buttermilk fried chicken, cheese curds, and gravy.  It's worth the cheat. 
 The Buffalo Bleu Fried Chicken sandwich is basically like eating buffalo wings on a waffle and if you like those, you'll like this item.  And, it's not really too spicy which I appreciate.  
The Bacon, Egg, and Cheddar waffle is nice for breakfast; you can add another egg and prosciutto to make it even nicer. 
 Ask for the Fluffernutter from the secret menu for a sweet little treat.  I still haven't tried the Lemon Cream and Berries, but it's on my list.
If you're in the area, try Bruxie out for a fast, casual, and fun meal.

The girl friends and I were out on the strip and stumbled upon this spot! We were actually looking for a breakfast and brunch place and was happy to find this cute little spot. We got there a little after 9 in the morning on a Sunday and it was already pretty busy. I suggest to get there early! If you love chicken,  and waffles, their chicken waffle sandwiches are great!

Great location in The Park to serve future hockey fans visiting the arena. The concept of serving mainly chicken and waffle sandwiches is unique and well executed. Service with a smile and very fast turn times on the food. The buffalo bleu and chicken waffle sandwich might be the best thing I've ever tasted. Will be back again soon!

Such good food can't go wrong with chicken and waffles. There was a line out the door but after eating there I totally see why.. worth the wait! I had the Nashville style waffle sandwich which was spicier than I expected, glad I got a side of ranch with it or my mouth would've been on fire. So glad I decided to stop here.

Fried #Chicken #Waffle sandwich from Bruxie #LasVegas . This place is total hype. But I can see why people dig it. Crispy #friedchicken with sweet slaw and a light crisp waffle for bread. The texture and flavor combinations are all there. But when you produce certain foods for mass consumption, it's way too hard to keep quality standards #high . And then it's only tasty if your high. If this dish was made to order it would have probably been #phenomenal . But you get what you pay for. I can't hate on them for fulfilling the masses.

My guy liked this so much, he said we have to make it out to the original one sometime. Chicken was so perfectly seasoned and crispy and the waffle didn't get soggy at all. Such a perfect choice for brunch!
Great place to grab and eat, we got there kind of early so the wait wasn't horrible.  So much food!!

This was a great place! Service was friendly and the food was delicious.. exactly what we needed after a long day of traveling. You can listen to live music while eating your meal. I definitely suggest this place if you're around New York New York or Monte Carlo.

Food was stellar. Soda, fries, chicken all quality. Only improvement if they read yelp is the line was so slow to order.  They had two registers, no idea if they noticed business walking away from the line from slow ordering. 

Plan to return.

I needed a place that was convenient before a concert at the T Mobile arena and so we made a stop here. I got the original fried chicken and waffle. It was the perfect guilty pleasure. My friend got the nashville hot tenders and she enjoyed those very much. We stayed next door and both my friend and I loved Bruxie, we ended up returning 2 times during our stay it was so good! It's great for people watching which was entertaining to say the least.

There was a lot of seating although the line up is usually long, it goes very fast!

The idea of chicken and waffles never really enticed me...until I had the opportunity to sample this combo at Parlay Gastropub (LI spot for those reading this who happen to live in Vegas). Just understand it became a concept I was open to...and then there was Bruxie which took things to another level.

Like, when I say another level I mean the top of the Stratosphere kind of level. Why not take thin, crispy waffles and fold them over to make chicken sandwiches? Why not fill them with crazy ingredients? Why didn't I think of this? Well I'm glad somebody did!

Bruxie, located in The Park on the side of New York New York, is something contemporary and cool enough to easily be found in the actual NYC (I wouldn't be surprised if it ends up there soon). I needed breakfast so what do I do? Yelp! Waffles? Chicken? Okay, that'll do.

But when I get there I don't just get chicken and waffles, no no no. At Bruxie things get interesting (in a good way). Holy chicken! That's the name of my breakfast-ish choice and it lived up to that name. Maple glazed chicken, applewood smoked bacon, cheddar cheese, Sriracha mayo, and a sunny side up egg. 

Honestly, words can't describe this thing. Okay, I'll try to use words: Sweet. Savory. Spicy. Sexy (wait, maybe not that last one....or maybe.....). Anyway, it's just everything you want when you think of chicken and waffles. Add in some waffle fries (clever) and their own brewed coffee and you'll end up with a meal that'll do you in for the day.

Overall, I'll be thinking (dreaming?) about Bruxie for quite some time. The creative and amazing tastes they concoct (and their employees were a class act too) make this place a must. Yeah, I know there are 5-star restaurants and gourmet chefs aplenty, but go to Bruxie. Just do it and be ready for something you won't soon forget.
I love a good lemonade and their strawberry lemonade is the bomb. I enjoyed the Irish nachos and the their waffle sandwich.

It was a long line but it went by fast! The food was a little over priced when getting two alcoholic drinks and two waffles it came to about $60 however the food was absolutely amazing and I will suggest this to many friends

We shared the original chicken waffle for $9.95.  It was a big disappointment.  The chicken was on the dry side, very little coleslaw, and it was just a normal tasting waffle.  Overpriced for what u get... probably wouldn't go back.
Loved my chicken and waffles brunch. The line was long, but it moved quickly. We found a table and we were mostly silent as we ate our delicious meal. The coffee was good too!

The food here is so good it's a must do... The cashier is beautiful and the guy dre  that comes and check on you was the best he was on top of everything and made sure everything was good the spot is a go to thanks Yelp.......

Had the buffalo chicken blue cheese waffle sandwich looks visually appetizing but did not satisfy tastewise. The ingredients dont work together, better off deconstructing the sandwich before eating eat.. wish I had done so before i reached the last few bites.

Ordered 3 piece fried chicken and waffle. 
All were thinly pounded breast meet drizzled in a very interesting sweet and spicy sauce. 
Pretty tasty!  Fresh!  Nice balance. 
Waffle was very interesting with pockets of crunchy sweetness. 
Certainly a unique place. Would go back.
Chicken and waffles, What a pair with custard at the end!  My favorite is the macaroni waffle.

Highly recommend this place for breakfast or brunch. Hands down The best chicken and waffles I have ever had. I got the Nashvile chicken and waffles, if you like spicy food then get it!. The coffee is really good too
Very good surprise I wasn't sure about the combination of waffles and fried chicken but really enjoyed the Ford great breakfast

Chicken and waffles.. in sandwich form! I love it! It was definitely very filling and greasy. But if you are into thinner waffles with a fat juicy slab of fried chicken in the middle, then you must try Bruxies! Although I wish there was a little more flavor in the waffles.. at least they have a dispenser of syrup and ketchup there for ya.

This place is awesome!  I will be recommending this to anyone I know visiting Vegas.

I got the chicken waffle sandwich.  Literally amazing.  The flavors matched perfect.  Chicken was cooked to perfection.  Staff asked us several times if we needed anything.  I also tried the banana nutella waffle for the sweet side of my taste and it was like I was floating in waffle heaven. 

I will be going back everytime I am in town.

Not your average chicken and waffles! Bring on the food belly!! Generous portions with so much flavor. Can't wait to tell you how yummy the waffles where they had bits of bacon in the waffle dough along with these itty bitty sweet crunchy pieces whatever they where it was friggen delicious!! The fried chicken had SO much flavor! I did get an added egg on top. I ordered the chicken & waffle plate. Will definitely recommend to anyone visiting Vegas! 
Oh and customer service was great too. Well there was this buss boy kid he was super quick on his feet cleaning every table & very attentive in asking everyone if they had needed anything.. Don't remember his name but kudos to him

This place is located in a great location, right next to New York New York casino. Faces a park like setting with Corn Hole and other games included. 

They are basically a fast food type of restaurant that serves really good food. Be prepared to wait in line though but was worth it. I had a chicken waffle sandwich. The waffle was crispy (used as the bread of the sandwich) and the chicken was warm and moist. Also included in it was shredded lettuce and their sauce. It was delicious, but I'm sure it was high in calories. Oh well...

I found this place by using my Yelp app on my phone. It came highly recommended and we weren't disappointed at all. We'll be back there again.

I totally loved this.  I don't eat full plates BUT..I did that day.   So the concept of this Chicken Waffle Taco was foreign to me.  And the fact it had "stuff" inside I was not sure I wanted it.  I always try new things so why not.  So after my first bite, I don't think I tasted much more because I inhaled the rest of it.  This invention was super yummy.  And it is so wonderful to know there is a location in Los Angeles.  I need to stay away from it because I will have this more often than I need.  

The lemonade was good too, and don't forget...it's Vegas so you can add a punch to your lemonade.  

The service here was VERY good.  Everyone was friendly and attentive.   

This place ROCKS!

Came here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. 

Ambiance: Nothing special. It can get loud and super crowded with people waiting for tables. The place isn't large so big parties will have trouble finding seats. The tables, chairs, and stools are pretty typical for a semi fast food chain. I say semi because its not really fast food but kinda is at the same time. 

Service: You go up to order and they bring the food to you. After you are done, you have to throw away your trash. So its not too much of a sit down and dine kind of service. Overall the servers are nice and polite. 

Food: Honestly, I think I was really hyped but I just thought it was okay. We ordered the crispy chicken sandwich and 3 pieces of fried chicken (2 original/1 Nashville) that comes with a waffle. It was good but it wasn't the yummy dance good. I was ready to have the biggest foodgasm when I got my food but I think my mental desires/expections for the food really override what was actually getting ingested. Therefore I think it was okay. Don't get me wrong it is still delicious but I don't think I would crave for it or go out of my way to get it.

I thought it was just okay and since I would probably not go back I give it 3 stars.

Love the chic Contemporary look of this place... Very Clean!!!!!! Atmosphere is very warm and inviting. The ketchup taste much better than regular ketchup and the maple syrup is to die for!!!! This was my first time going and I would give this a 10++ Star if I could. I recommend "The Original", The Bruxie Burger, Waffle fries are amazing, and the Blueberry Smoothie was a perfect combo of healthy and sweet!!! I will be back!!!!!! Manny the Barista was great and represented Bruxie in the most positive of light!!!! Thank you for bringing great food quality back to Vegas!!!
Great food! I had the original chicken waffle sandwich and it was amazing. My wife had the bacon and egg waffle sandwich, she really enjoyed it as well.

YUM YUM YUM. Had never really been curious about the whole chicken and waffle thing. Was just walking the strip after a night of partying. Something greasy and heavy sounded good. We decided to check this out. I bet Roscoes is amazing but WOW. It wasn't too heavy at all and tasted beyond what I thought it would. I ordered the original and couldn't get enough with the syrup. Definitely going back when I visit Vegas again
Great waffle sandwich! I had the original and Michelle had the eggs and cheese with a side of bacon.  Kids had a huge portion of waffles which were amazing and made great leftover snacks.

If your looking for a quick bite and saving money while in town, this is your place! A whole lot of fresh flavor and great comfort food. I had 2 different waffle sandwiches and both were delicious. The fried chicken itself was well seasoned and perfectly cooked. The waffles are light and surprisingly taste great as bread substitutes for sandwich making. Also the sauces in the sandwich really seal the deal, making this a great spot for good eats!

I love the variety of chicken waffle they have. This location has beer on tap (Vegas way). The outdoor seating area is very nice, good view and they have plenty of table available. 

Restroom is clean, at fast food standard 

Waffle cut friend is good, a bit too salty for me but still good. Strawberry lemonade is sour dominated, not too sweet so I love it! 

Waffle sandwich is awesome, the waffle is not too thick, give it a nice crispy texture.
