Chill place to hang out. Can't really speak for the afternoon. Was there for breakfast. The creme brûlée waffle was pretty good.  Use one of our cheat days to come here. Well worth it.

We ate here one the first morning in Vegas. So delicious and clean place to eat. Environment is fun and definitely walking distance from the strip. I don't think it is hangover worthy. Waffles were crisp and flavorful and the chicken was super juicy and delicious!! I regret not getting a sweet waffle.

Ok.  Wow!  I did not believe my friend when he told me this was his favorite fried chicken.  That he thought it might be the best fried chicken in Vegas.  How could it be?  He's been trying to get me to come here with him for a year.  Yep, I should have come with him sooner because I think he might be right.

We got our items to-go which made me think that it wouldn't be tasty by the time we walked back to MGM, got in the car and drove back to Cosmopolitan.  Again, I was wrong.  Fried chicken that tastes good lukewarm?  That's still crunchy?!?!  Sign me up please!  I can only imagine how seriously delicious it is hot, fresh from the fryer.

I got the caramel custard as well.  This custard was delicious!  Not too sweet and had a great fluffy texture.

I cannot wait to come back here and try EVERYTHING else on the menu.  SOOOOOOOOO GOOOOOOOOOOOD!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmy!!
This place is located in the Park on LV blvd. 
They have fresh juicy crispy buttermilk chicken tenders, fries and a waffles. We had the Nashville style chicken and it was spicy juicy goodness. The staff was very attentive and friendly. The place is very clean and the vibe was hip. 

Im already craving them for breakfast!! The pricing is very reasonable. I reccommend getting 6 tenders, fries and a side 2 waffles all to share for 20.00 The portions are pretty large.

Thr line was medium-lonh, but moved quickly. Very active place, but food was delicious. I got the backyard BBQ Sandwich and liked it. But if you're in the mood for desert or a sweet breakfast, their Nutella and Banana Waffle was rich and delicious.

Bruh. Lemme tell you. If you are into heart attack food, this is the place. Best chicken and waffles I've ever had; the "Holy Chicken!" Was drenched in syrup and was sweet, salty, savory, and dosed every part of my brain that loves food. We ordered a side of Irish nachos and it was too much! Heavy and hearty. My gf and i shared a sandwich and the fries, and we couldn't finish the fries. We were full. That's the kind of portions they got going on here. I would recommend this place if you dgaf about cholesterol or calories and just want to have your inner fat kid satiated. It will do the job well!

We've read the reviews, and since we like chicken, we decided to try them out. We were not disappointed! The chicken strips are very tasty. You can't really compare them with other places like Raising Cane's, etc. Because they are different. Definitely, a must try if you haven't already. If you haven't tried the chicken strips with the maple syrup, you must give it a try! It's the perfect blend of sweet and salty! 

PROS:
Chicken is very tasty; flavorful seasoning
Waffle cut fries are very good

CONS:
Can get busy depending on the time - thus a line
Sometimes when busy, few choice seats

I like hashtags because they look like waffles.

Ah, Bruxie.  Straight out of California and livin' the life in LAs Vegas. Who doesn't love chicken and waffles? We came here twice in one day and it was great. We had ordered a side of the Angry Mac & Cheese, a side of Fried Pickles, a Southern BBQ Waffle Sandwich, a side of the Bacon-Cheddar Waffle, and an order of the Irish Nachos. I loved it all! Like honestly, I don't think there was a bad bite. Everything was also tasty as leftovers. I especially went crazy over the angry mac & cheese and the Irish Nacho. Waffle fries, Bruxie Cheese Sauce, applewood smoked bacon, sour cream, and chives... it's a no brainer. Get in me!

If I have to say one bad thing, I think there were too many pearl sugars in my bacon-cheddar waffle because it became unbearably sweet after a few bites. No need for syrup. I just used the maple butter they supplied on top while trying to remove all the globs of pearl sugars I saw in the waffle. Decadence!
HOLY COW!!!!  i cannot believe how good this Bruxie original is.   Crispy sweet chicken inside a waffle as a sandwich with coleslaw... ON FIRE FOR REAL
Life changing food. So amazing. Pricing is decent for Vegas and very accessible. Loved it.

As an absolute lover of chicken and waffles I'm pretty picky about what I'll deem exceptional and Bruxie's is just that! I ordered the original chicken and waffle sandwich and requested the sauce on the side so I could try it individually with their signature sauce but also with the syrup. Note: syrup not needed cause their sauce is 100% on point! The chicken was cooked with just the right amount of crispiness and that right amount of good grease you need for this dish. Also the waffle was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside just as it should be. To drink I had their cherry cola which selling point here is that everything in their store is an in house production no 'name brands' all their own unique creations.  Everything paired extraordinarily well and the guest service was one of the best I have ever had!  I will most definitely be back at Bruxie's the next time I am in Vegas!

Visited Bruxie yesterday with my girlfriend for breakfast, they open at 9am. It was actually really good!!

I ordered the green eggs and ham, that pesto sauce they put inside is delicious! Add sriracha sauce to it and it gives it a nice kick!! My girlfriend ordered the chicken and waffle sandwich combo with waddle fries and a strawberry lemonade! We wish the strawberry lemonade was bigger, but it was good, definitely fresh! I love how they have water by the condiments as well!! 

The waffle fries were delicious, perfect salt and still soft, not too crunchy like it sat around the whole time. It's a nice place, quiet when they first open but starts getting busier around 10ish! It's a cute place!

I have to say I have been here twice and the first time was great. The second time was bad. The first time made to order. Fresh and delicious. The second round of going here they got my order wrong. Ordered the Tennessee hot and I got original and the chicken strips were not made to order. They were old and so disappointing. I want to love this place because of my first experience but if they can't be consistent I can't spend the extra money on something I could have gone to churches or Popeyes for for the 5 bucks!!!

The food was excellent! Definitely worth the long lunch rush wait. Andre the employee assisting customers in the dining area was absolutely phenomenal! He was on top of everything and took our experience to the next level! Best customer service in Vegas by far!

Awesome chicken waffles. The chicken cooked to perfect tenderness and maintaining a great crispy crust. The waffle was a 10/10. Cole slaw perfectly complemented the chicken waffle pairing giving the a good non sticky binding layer.

Reasonably priced for the location. Good ambiance and service.

I had crispy waffle sandwich. The waffles are light and crispy. Add a little syrup to take ur taste buds on a sweet and savory ride!  He had 2 pc chicken with the bacon waffle. He loved it!! This place is a must try!!
Had the original. Used a $5 off coupon for signing up for their newsletter. The chicken was hot and moist, inside a crispy (and not greasy waffle). Will go back again!

This place is seriously so yummy! Its right on the strip so I walked from my hotel (park mgm) and for breakfast for a great price! I ordered a plain waffle (which is super delicious on its own) with Nutella and bananas on the side (which were free with my purchase!). I would definitely not hesitate to come here again for brunch!

The flavors and texture were unbelievable! Both the chicken and the waffles were soft and crispy at the same time. 3 of the 4 people at the table claimed this was a top 5 meal of our lives! Got the Holy Chicken 10/10 would eat there every meal in Vegas if it were my choice. Worth the 12 bucks, easily.

The food is great!  The coffee is good (and not too expensive)!  Staff friendly!  What more can I say!

I will be back here as soon as we get back to Vegas.

Located in the park on the strip near the T-Mobile arena. I was surprised how much I enjoyed it. Had the Nashville chicken sandwich and it was pretty tasty. Their soda is homemade and you can tell it's made with real cane sugar very tasty. As a local I wish there was another one besides on the strip which I try to avoid but came on a slow Monday evening so it wasn't too bad. Price was a bit steep but I knew I'd be paying tourist price and it was good so can't complain too much about that.

EDC week requires you to have at least one epic meal a day in order to survive a wild night of non-stop dancing. Since we needed a massive caloric intake, the homies suggest we get ourselves some fried chicken goodness. We ended up getting the Holy chicken waffle sandwich, which is a maple glazed piece of fried chicken breast with apple wood smoke bacon, cheese, a sunny side up egg and comes with a side of waffle fries. The flavors of this concoction were out of this world! Overall, if you're in the area and want to experience a gourmet chicken and waffle orgasm then definitely make it a point to come to Bruxie!

Had the bacon, egg, and cheese waffle sandwich and it was awesome! My sister waited a little longer for her original waffle chicken sandwich and was disappointed when the waffle was cold after waiting so long for it. Other than that, we were very pleased!

Two of us ordered the Green Eggs and Ham and our other friend ordered the Sausage and Egg.
Quick service which was great because it isnt a sit and order type place and we were getting ready for a busy day. Size was good. I expected the waffle to be like a typical waffle, fluffy and a little bit sweet...it wasnt. It tasted more like toasted sliced bread. Not bad, but just wasnt what I was thinking it would be. By it resembling more bread it is much easier to eat the entire thing. I liked the establishment, lots of natural light and a huge fan to keep you cool. Menu was small as far as offerings but I think very well rounded.

I lurv waffles, but never got the entire chicken and waffle thing.  Are we going for a sweet/salty combo...or are we doing the crunchy...um, not crunchy thing?  What exactly is it that Chicken brings to the table here?  I just can't figure it out...

Well, Bruxie came in to answer my query.  The menu offered many good options:  waffle/chicken sandies (thin, airy waffles), waffle/chicken skillet (which appear to be different thicker, possibly chewier waffles), and salads (the "why bother" option).  We opted to share the seasonal crispy chicken (How this was different from the regular?  Um, I'm unsure.  There didn't appear to be any pumpkin spice).  Anyways, it was good.  The chicken was indeed very crispy and moist in the center.  At the condiment area, you could add mustard, sriracha, etc.  I liked the sriracha the most.  I think it was b/c with the sandwich, you already had something deep fried and plopped with an abundant amount of mayo.  So the vinegary chili kind of cut the richness.  And maybe if the waffle was thicker...like the waffles they let you make at hotels...that would be stellar!  

So I still don't think I need chicken with my waffles, but I'm certainly not against Bruxie's version.

Great place for chicken and waffles in vegas without hurting your wallet!  I'm starting to like all these quick and easy bites to grab.  Prices are ~10$ per waffle sandwich.  The Nashville chicken was on point, it packs a pretty satisfying spice without burning off your taste buds.  Chicken strips were breaded evenly and pretty general.  

If you get the nutella banana waffle I recommend getting the white cream on the side.  For some people the pairing is strange, so I was glad of having the option of not using it. 

I will come back!  I want to try the original sandwich and the cheddar bacon waffle skillet too!

I ordered the grilled chicken and it was delicious! The waffle is nice and crispy. We brought our kids in to eat also and one of the workers came over and gave my kids some ice cream for free. He also came and picked up and clean up after us. He was really nice and friendly.

Been here a couple of times now! Sucks that the Chicken Pesto Waffle thingy is off the menu but you can never go wrong with the Classic Chicken Waffle. It's tender, the sauce is incredible and the waffle is crisp.

Their maple syrup is on the light side so be sure to ask for extra bottles! And by bottles I mean the syrup comes in a tiny containers, so yeah, grab some if you need some.

Will be back for more! But lessen the butter smudge on the Naked Waffle

Naked waffle combo with a strawberry lemonade and side of fruit / chicken tenders and fries. All for $20. 

Pros - food was sooooo good. Waffle is very light and tasty. Chicken was fast and seasoned perfectly. Drink was good (free refills too). 

Cons - no close parking. We used the valet at New York New York. 

So with the valet tip , the experience for 2 is $23 . Not bad for being right on the strip.

After walking all over the strip and finally arriving at the New York New York hotel, I was excited that I was THIS close to finally getting the Bruxie waffle i have sooooo wanted to try. I was glad they opened one in Vegas since I haven't been able to make it to the LA location. It is a little hard to find as its on the side of the hotel and not inside or on the Las Vegas blvd side. It's around the corner from shake shack.

At 10pm at night, I was stoked to see there was NO line! I ordered the original chicken and waffle and a water. And then I almost fainted at how much my total was bc my water was almost as much as my chicken and waffle!!!!!!!! It was my bad for not noticing there was a "meal deal" (adding a drink/side to your waffle for a couple bucks more) but I wish the girl who was ringing me up would've mentioned something. Like "hey you wanna add a drink and a side to that for $3.95?". Because paying $7 bucks for smart water?! I already felt like a idiot for buying it but I was thirsty from speed walking all over the strip so I just sucked it up handed over my money. 

The chicken tho, was deeeeelicious. It was so freaking good. But the waffle was just ok. But the chicken. I could eat a plate of just that chicken alone! It was just perfect. Perfectly seasoned and fried, the right amount of crispness. It was just delicious. Def 5 stars for the chicken. But I had to give this place 4 stars for just the ok waffle and the Louis Vuitton priced water. 

I would still go back and give this place another try, there are a lot of good looking things on the menu that look worth trying.

Bruxie was excellent! The food and service were so good it motivated me to write my first Yelp review (after using Yelp frequently for 3 years.)

I had a bacon egg cheddar breakfast sandwich and my husband had a pastrami and Swiss sandwich. He really liked his too. The cashier answered my menu questions with patience and kindness.
Our food and drinks were brought to our table and removed as we finished by friendly staff. Even brought me a free refill on my soda.
Highly recommend. Wish we had a Bruxie near us in Chicago.

Had the 2 piece Nashville hot with the bacon cheddar waffle on our last day in Vegas. The flavor was on point, the meat was tender and juicy. I usually love my fried chicken with buffalo or Louisiana but the BBQ sauce here was spicy n' tangy, perfect sauce for this. It came with a side of pickles which compliments it well. Going to have to stop by this place in L.A.

This place is amazingg!! My group and I found this place while strolling on the strip right after where we had landed in Vegas!

A friend of mine recommended anything with the chicken so I got the buffalo bleu fried chicken on the first day and it was delicious! That first bite totally sold me. The chicken waffle combos are seasoned and tasty! Food arrived quickly as well. The second time I went I got the turkey avocado sandwich and it was simply the tasty and cooked to perfection. 

Some friends of mine tried the dessert waffles and even the poutine. Those also looked both social media worthy and equally delicious! 

Super excited to have found this place after seeing these pictures on social media.  If you LOVE waffles, you will love this place. DEFINITELY RECOMMENDED!

Visited Vegas & came across the restaurant & I must say, one of my best meals ever.I could of ordered one of everything on the menu. Best chicken & waffles I have ever had. Very tasty with lots of flavor. Chicken cooked perfectly. Waffle had bit of bacon in it. 
I would definitely revisit this place when in Vegas again.

I have never understood the combination of waffles and fried chicken, until a coworker and I stopped here for lunch and were hooked. I got the Nashville chicken and custard and wondered where this has been all my life. It was flavored perfectly and the lemonade was delicious. Customer service was great. I can't wait to go back, thanks for a great time!

Yelp brought me here. Good location right off the strip in The Park. Doesn't open until 9 am which is weird to me on a city that never sleeps. Moderately priced for $3.95 you can add fries and a drink to your waffle sandwich. The sodas are their own house brands of cola, diet cola, orange, and lemon lime. For $13 I got full and it was tasty so I definitely recommend .
First time and not the last! Food is just really good for the price ! Who doesn't like perfected chicken and waffles !

Amazing, amazing chicken and waffle sandwiches. Came here 2 days in a row. I got the original chicken waffle sandwich both days, while the hubs tried the Holy Chicken one day and the Southern BBQ the next. All were stellar. If you sign up for their mailing list, you get $5 off your first order.

Originally a restaurant from Orange, CA that has expanded greatly and now hit the strip - this is a great faster stop to get fried chicken and waffles in a fun and new location and building. Although I came in the winter cold, I suspect in the summer this place will be even more amazing once they open the garage-door style windows.

Food is wonderful, and on par with the LA location at which I've eaten.  I split the following:

Lemon Creme and Berries (Dessert) Waffle -- this is great, but tart so prepare yourself for that. It's an adorable waffle sandwich filled with lemon creme and... raspberries(!).  

Original Seasoned Crispy Chicken Tenders (comes with Waffle Fries) -- A classic fried chicken tender.  We asked for a side of the chili honey sauce to pour over as if our chicken was the original with bones... but had instead opted for the one that would be easier to eat.  The skin is crispy, the chicken juice, and finger-licking good.

Strawberry Lemonade -- Sugary, oh my.  But great to drink with the rest of the salty and sweet food we'd ordered. Also FREE REFILLS. Insert love eye emoji here.

An easy stop located on the outside of NYNY (more North from the standard entrance). Go on, you know you want to go.

I love this place. Perfect spot to eat before and after and event at T-Mobile Arena. Favs are the Cobb salad and of course chicken and waffles. The Palmer is refreshing plus they have cups for water if needed. Prices are very reasonable compared to most restaurants on the Strip.

We stumbled upon this place as we were exploring the strip. Located next to the "Park," this place definitely had a presentable and inviting atmosphere. Apparently, it was a new hype that we never heard about until we got there. 

We ordered the The Original Fried Chicken & Waffle, Chicken Tenders with Fries and two shakes.

First of all, I'd like to give the disclaimer that the chicken comes out boiling hot -- which, in my opinion, is a plus! If you burn yourself, well, then it's your fault for not being adult enough, haha. I wasn't really feeling the breading too much, which is why I'm knocking off half a star. It was lightly seasoned and was a bit thin for my liking. The meat though was white and delicious. 

The waffle was delicious and was a perfect combination for the chicken; however, the waffle broke as soon as my boyfriend picked it up. He had to use a fork and knife to eat it afterwards. As for the waffle fries ... well, let's say I was very disappointed. They tasted super chewy and like rubber. I love criss-cut fries too, but these were a total let down. 

I also thought the ranch was a little watered down, which didn't go too well when dipping our crunch chicken tenders. 

Overall, this place is OK if you're looking for a quick bite. They have a cool tabling technology where you just place your beeper on your table and the staff will know where your table is. We spent about $30+ for two people.

To begin, I've never had chicken and waffles before, so I didn't know what to expect. We stopped at this place, located at the New York New York Hotel and line was already building, so we thought "why not!". I ordered the Holy Chicken sandwich which had a poached egg, chicken breast, sriracha mayo and of course a waffle as the buns. 

When I took my first bite, I was absolutely amazed at how perfect the chicken was. It wasn't undercooked, overcooked, NOTHING! The meat and seasoning was ridiculously good, and the combination of that with the egg and Sriracha mayo made it one hell of a breakfast sandwich.

My only flaw was I paid 20 dollars for a sandwich, small coke and a side of fruit (that came with the sandwich). Seems overpriced as hell, but It was good.

Stopped in here for breakfast while checking out the new Park. I had the lemony fruit version of the waffle sandwich and it was delicious. Super tasty and very refreshing. I will be stopping in again for sure.

Great chicken and waffles.   2nd time here.   Chicken inside waffle pretty good but waffle just a bit dry.   I enjoyed my husband's plate more - chicken with a waffle on the side.   These waffles are fluffy and soft and oh my I couldn't stop eating it.  I would definitely return here.   So much more to try on the menu.

This is my second time here at Bruxies and it was just as good as the first time. Perfect hangover food, thin crispy waffles with great flavored fried chicken. We went around 2 pm so there was no one else really there opposed to if you go in the morning. This place is a must try in Vegas
Got the original chicken waffle. It was very good had a honey taste to it. $17 for sandwich and drink.

First thing i wanted to do after my first bite of the original chicken waffle sandwich was to cry. Second thing that came to mind after my first bite of the Irish nachos was "cant wait to comeback tomorrow". The strawberry lemonade was so fresh i just have to label this place as my favorite waffle, chicken, cheese sauce, and drink place in LV!!!

Must stop if your looking for a fresh breakfast with awesome flavors ;)

Way great food. I'm here with my brothers and sister for my sisters 45th birthday! She flew in from Virginia with her husband as a surprise. Me and my brothers haven't seen her in 4 years. We came here for breakfast and it's damn good. I'm a tough customer, but the these guys put customer service first and that's very hard to find now a days. 

I'm impressed!! Very impressed. Great food across the board I had the Nutella and bananas.

Went to Bruxie for the first time last week and I'm so glad that we decided to come back for it! Initially, we went on a Thursday morning around 10:45am. The line was out the door and we were starving so we ended up settling for Shake Shack next door. Saturday morning we wanted to try again but this time we were smart and went right before it opened. They open at 9, but they started letting people in about 10-15 minutes early!! We almost had to wait in a long line again because we didn't realize they opened early! 

Ambience (5/5) - I really like the sort of hipster feel to the place. They have really large windows that lets in sunlight and really brightens up the place. It's a very clean environment and I love that. 

Holy chicken! (5/5) - If you're a person that likes the sweet and salty combination, I would definitely recommend this! I am very picky about chicken because a lot of places make chicken extremely dry but Bruxie's chicken is definitely not dry. It was a juicy and savory piece of chicken that was maple glazed and TASTED SO WELL TOGETHER! 

Fried chicken w/ bacon cheddar waffle and maple butter (5/5) - I'm not sure if we got the original seasoned or the kickin chicken but whatever we got was amazing. Then again I am really biased because I love pairing little big of sweetness and savory. 

Bruxie Burger (3/5) - Don't get it. If you're really craving a burger then go get a burger next door at shake shack or any other places that actually makes burgers. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't bad! It's just that Bruxie is known for their chicken.. SO GET THE CHICKEN.. promise you won't regret getting the chicken.
Perfect hangover cure after a night out on the town! Waffles and fried chicken, the perfect blend of sweet and savory.

Chicken and waffles? I can't complain. Please take me there now. This was the first place I've ever been to from chicken and waffles, and I'm so glad. The Hot Nashville Chicken is above all, my favorite of all time. What does it come with? Spicy & Smoky Chicken, Tangy Sauce, Shredded Romaine, and Pickles. This entree is down to the science. Spicy, savory, crunchy, yet soft and then sweet from the syrup. If there's anything better than this meal, please don't tell me about it because I'm pretty much adamant about this. 

The service is fast despite the crazy long lines, and there's always a place to sit even when, again, it's busy. This is my happy place when I'm around the area, and I don't think that would ever change. Also, you should try their mac and cheese! It's like one of the best appetizers I've ever had.

I'm not a chicken and waffles fan, I've always wondered who was the first to come up with the concept. My friend and I discovered Bruxie after leaving the NY NY hotel: None of the restaurants around the casino area really stood out to us. While walking towards the strip, we decided to give it a shot. I scanned the menu and was happy to see there was a burger available for me to enjoy. I chose the Mac and cheese instead of fries.

We sat down by one of the huge open windows facing the busy strip. When the server brought out my burger, immediately I was confused because I didn't order a waffle. Suddenly it hit me that even the burger was served atop waffles. I gave it a bite, and was very happy we chose Bruxie to have our last Vegas meal. The Mac could have been cheesier, which is my preference, but I was relieved it wasn't bland. I've noticed that happens at restaurants so often.

The cheese to patty ratio was on point and the waffle was crisp on the outside yet airy. It was a good balance for the beef. Definitely a win!

Love how this place is super close to the t mobile arena and the food was delicious. My husband and I came here for lunch one day because our friends kept talking about it and it had great reviews on yelp. 

We parked in the garage near by and walked along the little area of shops, restaurants, and bars. I thought it was cool how clean it was and how it didn't really make me feel like I was in Vegas. 

When we got to the restaurant there was no line so we were able to ask all the questions we wanted to ask. The cashier wasn't rushing us and was very friendly. 

We ended up getting the chicken and waffles, chicken sandwich, and Nutella banana (suggestion of the cashier). Everything was delicious. We both loved how tender and juicy the chicken was and the Nutella didn't disappoint. 

Overall, the service was great and the food was delicious. Will be coming here in the future.
Yum yum yum. Fresh. Juicy. The whole menu is delicious and affordable. Nice seating , open and spacious. Food is made quickly but not too fast. Excellent brunch spot.
